Learn to illuminate
your data

Learn to better understand and communicate the results of your analyses. Empower your stakeholders and improve your decision making. Crow Insight offers training on data visualization concepts and data communication...

Introduction to Advanced Data Visualization

In this workshop, you’ll learn how and why data visualization can help you analyze your data more quickly and deeply. You’ll learn a framework for visualization, the Power-Up model, which places data visualization techniques into three groups: preparation, data density, and exploration. You’ll explore how the purpose of the visualization should drive the choice of elements to add (or subtract). Through an in-depth case study and several short exercises, you’ll examine real-world examples of graphics and dashboards to understand how the Power-Up techniques can be applied to your data.

Communicating Clearly Using Advanced Data Visualization

This workshop will help you apply principles studied in Intro to Advanced Data Visualization to data that must be shared with an audience. You’ll learn the most important Power-Ups to consider when communicating data. For instance, you’ll learn how to draw attention to the message in your visualization using color and order and to select the most useful format. You’ll then discover how to combine your graphics with the right titles and context to make your data story resonate with viewers and readers. Exercises and examples will give you practical and common-sense tips to help you clarify your story.

Sticky Digits: The Art and Science of Communicating Data

Even when you know the data story you want to tell, it can be challenging to convey it effectively. In this workshop, you’ll learn a practical and memorable formula for making your story stick. You’ll learn to make your message concise, relatable, and credible, both through annotations and accompanying text and through the design of the data visualization itself. In addition, you will learn tips for data presentation that can be applied even if you don’t have specialized software, using common products like PowerPoint and Excel. You’ll participate in individual and group exercises to practice improving your messaging.
